main_definition: Do-It-Yourself refers to activities or projects that individuals undertake without professional help, typically involving building, repairing, or modifying items using their own skills and resources.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A hobby of creating or fixing things at home
meanings_and_examples.example: I enjoy painting and crafting as a DIY hobby. Last weekend, I made a beaded necklace for my friend.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Projects that involve building or constructing items oneself
meanings_and_examples.example: Building our own furniture was a fun DIY project during the summer break. We made a bookshelf from scratch using wooden planks and screws.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Doing home improvements without professional assistance
meanings_and_examples.example: We decided to remodel our kitchen by ourselves as a DIY project, which saved us money but required careful planning and execution.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Creating or modifying products in a self-taught manner
meanings_and_examples.example: I started making my own candles at home using essential oils. It's a relaxing DIY activity that also allows me to customize the scents.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Using readily available materials and tools for repairs or creations
meanings_and_examples.example: When our car broke down, we used online tutorials and basic hand tools to diagnose and fix it as a DIY repair job. It worked out great!
